Package com.github.tcn.plexi.ombi

Class OmbiCallers

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.tcn.plexi.ombi.OmbiCallers
  • public class OmbiCallers
extends java.lang.Object
    OmbiCallers is the heart of Plexi.
    It is responsible for making almost every request to the ombi API. Contained in this class are methods that call Ombi endpoints and return objects of the resulting data

    • Method Detail

      • ombiTvSearch

        public TvSearch[] ombiTvSearch​(java.lang.String toSearch)
        Forms a connection to the Ombi API and performs a search for the string passed via the toSearch parameter. The downloaded JSON is then converted into a TvSearch array via Gson.fromJson(String, Type)
        Parameters:
        toSearch - The String that should be passed to the Ombi search API
        Returns:
        An array of TvSearch objects. Each object is one search result
        "Implementation Note:"
        This method gets its info via the /api/v1/Search/tv/{string} Ombi endpoint

      • ombiMovieSearch

        public MovieSearch[] ombiMovieSearch​(java.lang.String toSearch)
        Forms a connection to the Ombi API and performs a search for the string passed via the toSearch parameter. The downloaded JSON is then converted into a MovieSearch array via Gson.fromJson(String, Type)
        Parameters:
        toSearch - The String that should be passed to the Ombi search API
        Returns:
        An array of MovieSearch objects. Each object is one search result
        "Implementation Note:"
        This method gets its info via the /api/v1/Search/movie/{string} Ombi endpoint

      • ombiTvInfo

        public TvInfo ombiTvInfo​(java.lang.String id)
        Forms a connection to the Ombi API and requests more info about a tv show given its TVDb id number. The downloaded JSON is then converted into a TVInfo object via Gson.fromJson(String, Type)
        Parameters:
        id - The TVDb ID number of the show you want more info on
        Returns:
        A TvInfo object
        "Implementation Note:"
        This method gets its info via the /api/v1/search/tv/info/{id} endpoint

      • ombiMovieInfo

        public MovieInfo ombiMovieInfo​(java.lang.String id)
        Forms a connection to the Ombi API and requests more info about a movie given its TMDb id number. The downloaded JSON is then converted into a MovieInfo object via Gson.fromJson(String, Type)
        Parameters:
        id - The TMDb id number of the movie you want more info on
        Returns:
        A MovieInfo object
        "Implementation Note:"
        This method gets its info via the /api/v1/search/movie/info/{id} endpoint

      • requestMovie

        public java.lang.String requestMovie​(java.lang.String id)
        Forms a connection to the Ombi API and requests a movie given its TMDb id number. The downloaded JSON is converted into an object internally and the response is extracted from that.
        Parameters:
        id - The TMDb id number of the movie to request
        Returns:
        The string response from the API
        "Implementation Note:"
        This method performs the request via the /api/v1/request/movie endpoint

      • requestTv

        public java.lang.String requestTv​(boolean latest,
                                  TvInfo tvInfo)
        Forms a connection to the Ombi API and requests a TV show given its TVDb id number, tvInfo object, and if you want to request only the latest episodes.
        Parameters:
        latest - A boolean value that states if the request should only request the latest episodes of a show
        tvInfo - A TvInfo object build from the show that you want to request
        Returns:
        A string stating request success status
        "Implementation Note:"
        This method performs the request via the /api/v1/request/tv endpoint

      • getMissingEpisodeArray

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getMissingEpisodeArray​(java.lang.String id)
        Creates a String ArrayList containing all episodes that are not marked as available and are not requested in ombi. If an episode is missing and requested, it WILL NOT be in this list.
        Parameters:
        id - The TVDb id number of the show
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing all missing and not requested episodes of a show
        "Implementation Note:"
        This method gets its information from ombiTvInfo(String id)

      • getTvLiteArray

        public TvLite[] getTvLiteArray()
        Forms a connection to Ombi and requests a list of all requested TV shows in the form of a TvLite object array. The downloaded JSON is then converted into a TvLite array via Gson.fromJson(String, Type)
        Returns:
        An Array of TvLite objects
        "Implementation Note:"
        This method performs the request via the /api/v1/request/tvlite endpoint

      • getPingTime

        public long getPingTime()
        Forms a connection to Ombi and counts the amount of time it took for it to respond to an API request.
        Returns:
        the amount of time it took for Ombi to respond in milliseconds
        "Implementation Note:"
        This method gets info via the /api/v1/Status endpoint which takes ombi very little time to calculate. This means that this method will return the best case response time. Other endpoints in Ombi will take a much longer time to respond.

      • removeMediaRequest

        public boolean removeMediaRequest​(int requestID,
                                  int mediaType)
        Given a request id and the media type, this method removes a request from Ombi. This CANNOT be passed the media ID, which means that you must get the request ID from another API call.


        For movies, see MovieInfo.getId()


        For TV, the TvInfo API call seems to provide an invalid request id. This means that you MUST get it another way. One way is via looping through getTvLiteArray() until you find a matching TVDb ID. (Annoying, I know)


        Parameters:
        requestID - The internal Ombi request ID for a movie or show
        mediaType - The media type of the object. 1 == TV Show || 2 == Movie
        Returns:
        false if the API fails to remove the request, true otherwise.
        "Implementation Note:"
        This method completes the Delete action via the /api/v1/Request/tv/{REQUEST_ID} and /api/v1/Request/movie/{REQUEST_ID} endpoints
